lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to observe (a law, regulation, or agreement)

sentence.text: So it was that the agreement on which the first National Government was formed was ignored by the King , who granted a dissolution under conditions which broke both the letter and the spirit of the agreement .
It would clearly be wrong to restrict all imports from a country which broke one particular environmental agreement .
By breaking that agreement , homosexuals ` got the backlash they asked for . "
Stracar called for Czechoslovak firms to halt all but essential imports from East Germany , complaining that the East Germans had broken trade agreements for 1990 .

In the aftermath of the Sacheverell affair of 1710 , a group of Welsh Anglicans formed " a League to have no Commerce with Dissenters " , imposing fines on those who broke the terms of this agreement .
If any of these conditions is broken , then so is the contract between you and the supplier .
In High Trees , the landlord , having accepted half rent for , say , one year , would clearly have been precluded from asserting , ` You have broken your contract and I forfeit the lease .
` But if he wishes to break the contract , then the contract will be broken . "
US Treasury officials have warned the promoter , Bob Arum , that he risks breaking the law by selling the fight to a Panamanian TV station .

Virtually all the largest American corporations broke the law in one way or another ; laws controlling pollution , the adulteration of products , the regulating of prices and so on were ignored and broken at will .
The Data Protection Registrar is quoted as warning local councils that they could break the law if they maintain a register of all adults for the council tax .
One function is to , to visit retribution or sanctions upon people who have broken the law .
Throughout her career she successfully broke the rules of haute couture until her name became synonymous with French chic .
Many of the more worrying disciplinary problems of childhood and adolescence involve moral rules , and it is when children break these rules that parents become most perturbed .
With bold images designed to convince bosses and clients quickly , such programs make it easy to break the rules of objective data display .

It followed an inquiry after a court case last year when the company was fined 1800 for allowing drivers to break rules on the number of hours they could drive .

Last November he appealed against the sentence , imposed on him for breaking a ban on keeping livestock .
Though there is clearly a potential conflict of interest , it is far from clear that the law against insider trading would be broken by a firm that took advantage of it .
` We shall break the historic habit because we shall not just get elected tomorrow to clear up the mess , we are going to get re-elected at the next general election as well , " he said .
